is the name for the motion-picture industry in India. The term is also
 used to describe a certain type of film associated with that industry. Bollywood is one
 of the largest film industries in the world, releasing thousands of movies each year.
 The industry is based in Mumbai. The term Bollywood is a combination of the words Bombay
 (a former name for Mumbai) and Hollywood (California, the motion-picture capital of the
 world). Bollywood films are made in the Hindi language. Most Bollywood movies are
 musicals, featuring singing and dancing. But some are action and adventure films. The
 plots emphasize romance, comedy, and melodrama. The...

The term is also used to describe a certain type of film associated with

is a combination of the words

, the motion-picture capital of the world). The name Bollywood became popular
 beginning in the 1990's.
Bollywood films are made in the

featuring singing and dancing. But some are action and adventure films. The
 plots emphasize romance, comedy, and melodrama. The dancing is typically based on
 traditional Indian classical dance and folk dances. The songs are usually prerecorded by
 professional singers known as

the songs on the screen—that is, they move their
 lips as though they are singing the songs.
India's first experience of motion pictures came in 1896, when the French brothers

screened six soundless short films in Bombay. In 1899, photographer
 Harishchandra Bhatavdekar became the first Indian to shoot and exhibit a film in India.
 The first Indian silent feature film was

released in Bombay

Shammi, and Shashi Kapoor; Raj Kapoor's sons Randhir, Rishi, and Rajiv Kapoor;

—are presented annually for artistic and technical excellence in filmmaking in
 the Hindi language. The Indian screen magazine

presents the awards in
 more than 30 categories. Magazine readers submit their votes, and the awards are
 presented at a ceremony in Mumbai. Filmfare Awards were first presented in 1954. The
 government of India has also presented its own motion-picture awards, the National Film
 Awards, since 1954.
